# [[pot]]; [[can]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|on=[[かん]] (kan), {{qualifier|historical}} [[くゎん]] (kwan); {{qualifier|Chinese-based readings seldom used in Japanese}} [[ふ]] (fu), [[ふう]] (fū)
|kun=[[かま]] (kama), [[ほとぎ]] (hotogi)
|nanori=[[ふ]] (fu), [[べ]] (be)
}}

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|缶詰|かんづめ}}: [[canned]] food; [[confinement]] for a particular purpose
* {{ja-r|缶詰業|かんづめぎょう}}: the [[canning]] [[industry]]
* {{ja-r|缶詰業者|かんづめ ぎょうしゃ}}: a [[canner]], someone who [[cans]] as a [[business]]
* {{ja-r|缶詰工場|かんづめ こうじょう}}: a [[cannery]], a [[canning]] [[plant]]
* {{ja-r|缶詰食品|かんづめ しょくひん}}: [[canned]] [[food]]
* {{ja-r|缶石|かんせき}}: [[scale]], [[lime]] and other [[deposits]] left behind in a [[boiler]], [[kettle]], or similar device
* {{ja-r|缶切り|かんきり}}, {{ja-r|缶切|かんきり}}: a [[can opener]]
* {{ja-r|缶胴|かまどう}}: the [[boiler]] of a [[steam engine]]
* {{ja-r|缶焚き|かまたき}}, {{ja-r|缶焚|かまたき}}: [[minding]] a [[boiler]] [[fire]] for a [[steam engine]]; a [[steam engine]] [[fireman]], [[tender]], or [[stoker]]
* {{ja-r|缶偏|かまへん}}: the [[Chinese character]] [[radical]] consisting of the {{ja-r|缶|缶}} character
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 1===
Originally from {{etyl|nl|ja|sort=かん}} {{m|nl|kan||cylindrical metallic container}}, with additional influence from {{etyl|en|ja|sort=かん}} {{m|en|can||cylindrical metallic container}}. The kanji is an example of [[ateji]].

====Pronunciation====
* [[音読み|On'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/ka.ɴ/|[kã̠ɴ]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|鑵}}, {{l|ja|カン}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かん}}

# a [[can]], a [[tin]]

===Etymology 2===
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かま}} ''kama'', signifying a container for high heat and referring variously to a {{m|en|hearth}}, {{m|en|oven}}, {{m|en|pot}}, {{m|en|kettle}}.

====Pronunciation====
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/ka.ma/|[kämä]}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|竈}}, {{l|ja|釜}}, {{l|ja|窯}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かま}}

# a [[boiler]], as for a [[steam engine]]

=====Usage notes=====
For the {{m|en|boiler}} sense, this term ''kama'' is most often spelled using the kanji {{lang|ja|缶}}.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|ボイラー}}
